title: How is the Parental Control heuristic determined on Windows 10?
content:
I tried to enable DNS over HTTPS and have spent almost two hours now trying to figure out why it didn't work. After enabling logging I finally found the culprit: "TRRService::GetParentalControlEnabledInternal=1". Luckily I can disable this by setting the network.dns.skipTRR-when-parental-control-enabled to false.

I am an adult who manages my own personal computer. As far as I am aware, I have not enabled parental controls in Windows. The only thing I can think of that might affect this is "Let apps use advertising ID to make ads more interesting to you based on your app activity" in Settings -> Privacy -> General, which I have turned off.

To avoid digging through the code trying to figure out why Firefox thinks my computer/user has parental controls enabled, I figured I would ask here. I got this far before realizing I was in way over my head: line 183 of netwerk/dns/TRRService.cpp and some resources about the "Parental Controls Service".

(A note about DNS-over-HTTPS: TRR was consistently disabled until I changed network.dns.skipTRR-when-parental-control-enabled to false. TRR was reported as disabled by about:networking#dns and https://1.1.1.1/help)
creator: tertsoya

title: I thought that I was updating Firefox and everything would be okay.  I'm totally at a loss and anxious as hell!
content:
Something was wrong with my computer tonight when I turned it on. One of your FIREFOX pages came up and suggested that I "upgrade," I guess. Anyway, several iterations later and I was back online. I noticed, though, that several ICONS that I had before were missing now. Worse than that, I went to my "Files" and "Downloads" and they have all apparently disappeared.

I am not terribly Computer Savvy and so there may be some solution that I just don't know about. At least, I hope that's the case - AND I HOPE THAT ONE OF YOUR TECHNICIANS CAN HELP ME RETRIEVE THEM.

In a terrible bind,

Eric Vollmer - 3/7/2022
creator: voiceinthewell

title: FF Crashing, Acting Erratic (Slow, Pages not Displaying Correctly): Want to Uninstall LAST Update
content:
I reinstalled FF a few weeks back, and it's still crashing way too much. Pages are taking forever to populate, some pages on the same site do NOT show "add to cart" but when I tried it on Chrome it worked. This issue is increasing where pages work on Chrome only. I am really frustrated I have to jump hoops just to get something done. I do NOT want to use Chrome.

I did a FF update 2 days ago and this is where the extreme slowness and inconsistent issues started getting bad. I want to UNINSTALL my last update: Version 97.0.2 (64-bit). I'm on Windows 10 which is up-to-date. If I have to unstall FF constantly to fix issues, then I'll remove it completely and find another browser. I can't stand the fact it loads browser extensions I can NOT remove that I do NOT use and taking up precious space, every little bit helps...
creator: jj
